REPUBLIC OF SOUTH AFRICA
THE SUPREME COURT OF APPEAL OF SOUTH AFRICA
Case No 179/96 In the appeal between:
SAMUEL GROENEWALD
Appellant
and
ANNA WILHELMINA GROENEWALD
Respondent
Before: Mahomed CJ, Olivier, Zulman, Plewman and Streicher JJA. Heard: 19 February 1998 Delivered: 23 March 1998
JUDGMENT
STREICHER JA.

sections.facts: The appellant, Samuel Groenewald, appealed against a judgment in a matrimonial dispute with his wife, Anna Wilhelmina Groenewald, involving divorce, spousal maintenance and the division of matrimonial property.
sections.issues: The core issues were whether the lower court erred in granting the divorce, in determining the amount of spousal maintenance, and in the allocation of matrimonial assets between the parties.
sections.principles: The Court applied the South African Divorce Act, relevant jurisprudence on equitable division of property, and principles governing spousal maintenance, emphasizing fairness and the financial needs of both parties.
sections.application: Applying these principles, the Court examined the contributions each spouse made to the marriage, their respective earning capacities, and the overall financial circumstances to assess whether the lower court’s orders were appropriate.
sections.conclusion: The Supreme Court of Appeal dismissed the appeal, confirming the lower court’s decision on divorce, maintenance and property division.
